CIRCULAR  25  /  1998 
 
SUB 
:ISSUE OF SHOW CAUSE NOTICE TO AIR OPERATORS ON 
COMMITTING BREACH OF SECURITY IN THEIR SECURITY 
FUNCTIONS AT THE AIRPORT 
 
 
Broadly the security related functions of air operators have been mentioned in this 
Bureau Circular No.  CAS-6 (1) / 96 –Div-VI dated 04.09.97 besides other circulars on 
security issued by BCAS from time to time.  Instances have come to notice of this Bureau 
that directions on security issued by this Bureau are violated by air operators, which may lead 
to failure to safeguard civil aviation operations against acts of unlawful interference. 
 
2. 
It has, therefore, been decided that the air operators wherever found committing 
breach of security shall be issued with show cause notices on the proforma enclosed 
herewith by the concerned RDCOS. 
 
3. 
On receipt of explanation from the air operators who are found committing breach of 
security, matter will be taken up by RDCOS concerned with BCAS Hqrs.  for taking 
necessary action against the defaulting air operator. 
 
 
This issues with the approval of Commissioner of Security (CA). 
 
(J.P. VERMA) 
OFFICER ON SPECIAL DUTY (INT) 
 
REF: NO.CAS-3  (45) / 98-DIV-I
